fxInfo_citation: V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: Exceptions to the norm of direct election include members who are appointed, e.g., by an executive, the military, or a theocratic body, and members who are indirectly elected by local/regional parliaments, country/city councilors or similar. Thus, if 10 % of a upper chamber is appointed in some fashion the correct answer to this question would be 90 %.
fxInfo_notes: Converted from B to A coding.
fxInfo_question: What percentage of the upper chamber of the legislature is directly elected in popular elections?
fxInfo_sources: Nohlen et al. (1999, 2002, 2005, 2010); Chronicle of Parliamentary Elections (IPU); Websites of national parliaments.
